intro: Gomesa silvana, commonly known as the silverleaf gomesa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a silvery or grayish underside, giving it its common name. Gomesa silvana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
